intro: Compsoneura debilis, commonly known as the weakstemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The species is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
